League of Legends Rambah Mobile, Eksklusif di Oppo
04 Nov 2019, 19:27 by Rachmatunnisa - detikInet


Foto: istimewa

Jakarta - Riot Games mengumumkan game PvP populer besutannya, League of Legends (LoL), hadir di platform selain PC. Versi terbaru game ini, Wild Rift, ditujukan untuk konsol dan perangkat mobile. Studio game tersebut sudah mengindikasikan kalau Android adalah platform pertama yang menjadi rumah bagi LoL versi mobile. Riot Games bahkan mengerucutkannya lagi dengan memilih OPPO sebagai ponsel pertama yang secara eksklusif kedatangan LoL.Tidak diketahui akan berlangsung berapa lama eksklusivitas ini. Namun sejatinya, pemilihan Oppo sebagai ponsel pertama yang kedatangan LoL tidak mengherankan. Sebelumnya, Oppo memang sudah aktif mendukung Riot Games menggelar sejumlah turnamen LoL. Bahkan, Oppo pada Oktober lalu menyatakan akan mensponsori turnamen game LoL hingga 2024. Pabrikan ponsel adal China ini percaya diri bahwa software dan AI yang dikembangkannya cukup menjadi modal untuk mendukung event dan liga profesional bahkan yang serius. Berbicara Wild Rift, Riot Games dengan tegas meyakinkan bahwa game ini lebih dari sekadar versi yang di-port dari PC. Varian terbaru ini akan punya maps dan kontrol sendiri untuk mode klasik 5v5. Di sisi lain, Riot Games juga mengingatkan bahwa tidak semua champ, skin atau lock dari game klasik ini akan diboyong ke mobile. Selain itu, durasi pertandingan game versi terbaru akan lebih pendek, sekitar 15-20 menit, sesuai dengan feedback dari para fans game ini.League of Legends: Wild Rift dijadwalkan mulai tersedia awal 2020. Kalian yang ingin jadi yang pertama menjajalnya, bisa melakukan pre-register di Play Store. Simak Video "Nintendo Ingatkan Para Gamers: Jangan Boros Main Game Mobile"[Gambas:Video 20detik](rns/fay)
text:
League of Legends goes to Mobile, Exclusive to Oppo
Nov 04 2019, 19:27 by Rachmatunnisa - detikInet


Photo: special

Jakarta - Riot Games announces its popular PvP game, League of Legends (LoL), present on platforms other than PC. The latest version of this game, Wild Rift, is intended for consoles and mobile devices. The game studio has indicated that Android is the first platform that is home to the mobile version of LoL. Riot Games even pursed it again by choosing OPPO as the first cellphone exclusively for the arrival of LoL. It is unknown how long this exclusivity will last. But in truth, the selection of Oppo as the first mobile phone to come by LoL is not surprising. Previously, Oppo was already actively supporting Riot Games to hold a number of LoL tournaments. In fact, Oppo in October said it would sponsor a LoL game tournament until 2024. The Chinese mobile phone manufacturer is confident that the software and AI that it developed is sufficient capital to support professional and even serious events and leagues. Speaking of Wild Rift, Riot Games firmly assured that this game is more than just a ported version of the PC. This latest variant will have its own maps and controls for the classic 5v5 mode. On the other hand, Riot Games also reminded that not all champ, skin or lock from this classic game will be brought to mobile. In addition, the duration of the latest version of the game will be shorter, around 15-20 minutes, according to feedback from fans of this game. League of Legends: Wild Rift is scheduled to be available beginning in 2020. Those of you who want to be the first to try it out, can pre register on the Play Store.
